story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet scored 51 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.text_on_screen: Should You Race Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet?

broll_sources.query: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet gravel race

beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet. Hot Springs, North Carolina. 75 mi. Appalachian mountain gravel with challenging climbing.
beats.text_on_screen: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet | Hot Springs, North Carolina | 75 mi

broll_sources.query: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet route map
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet course walkthrough

beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: The numbers. All fourteen of them. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Mountain passes on the menu. Length. 3 out of 5. Proper race distance. Enough to hurt. Dylan Johnson's back-to-back wins in 3:11-3:12 show the 61-mile course delivers proper endurance challenge without excessive punishment. Technicality. 3 out of 5. Requires line choice. Rewards the attentive rider. The course is billed as the 'Hilliest Course Yet! Adventure. 3 out of 5. Genuine adventure elements. Expect the unexpected. Hot Springs functions as an Appalachian Trail resupply town where 'thru hikers mix with cyclists' creating unique trail town atmosphere. Experience. 3 out of 5. You'll remember this one. Mostly fondly. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. 'Hot Springs has a tiny and vibrant downtown' with restaurants and breweries where participants mix with Appalachian Trail thru-hikers. Value. 3 out of 5. Fair value. You get what you pay for. $85 early entry gets you 61 mountainous miles, a custom water bottle, pre-race party, and post-race camping with food. Expenses. 3 out of 5. Standard gravel race budget.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: And the rest of the scorecard. Logistics. 2 out of 5. Basic setup. Don't expect hand-holding. Climate. 2 out of 5. Mild conditions. Nothing dramatic. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Known in certain circles. Niche following. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Adequate. Room for improvement. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Enough competition to keep you honest. Altitude. 1 out of 5. Sea level. Your lungs get a day off.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.narration: What Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet gets right.
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment

broll_sources.query: Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet finish line
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet race highlights

beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS

broll_sources.query: Hot Springs, North Carolina travel guide
Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet race day

beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Lodging: Hot Springs has limited lodging. Asheville has more options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Remote Appalachian Mountain Gravel. If you're in North Carolina and want a remote mountain challenge. yes, it's a solid regional event. If you're from out of state. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet isn't quite right for you. For better Southeast events: Gravel Worlds, Pisgah Monster-Cross. For similar regional events: other NC gravel races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, 'Hot Springs Gravel Gauntlet' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.
